segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading right under her feet, but she doesn’t even glance down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for cookies like he’s on a secret mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip, and I can’t believe no one’s stopping him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, not a care in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is so focused on that plate, she might as well be in another room.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and it’s only a matter of time before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ll even notice until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing’s wrong at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting a warning, but I don’t think they’d hear me anyway.
segments.speaker: PAR
